Key Match Events: Bobby Miller gave up seven runs, including five in the first inning, in a 10-1 loss to the Angels.
Mickey Moniak hit a three-run home run, and Niko Kavadas and Taylor Ward also hit home runs against Miller.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers continued to believe in Bobby Miller's potential, but he'd have to back it up with his late-season performances to be counted on in October.
Manager Dave Roberts said performance matters, and Miller needs to perform to give the team a chance.
Post-Match Reflections: Miller said he's not happy about the loss and will have to forget about it and move on.
Roberts said Miller would make his next start Wednesday against the Chicago Cubs, but the clock is ticking for him to salvage his season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers are getting pitching reinforcements with Yoshinobu Yamamoto's return and Tyler Glasnow's progress in his recovery from elbow tendinitis.
The team might not need Buehler or Miller in its potential postseason rotation with Jack Flaherty and Gavin Stone showing more consistency.
Others: The Angels' Shohei Ohtani returned to Anaheim and proved why Dodger Stadium is a better home, according to Hernandez's article.
